summary: This bill, the Emerging Innovative Border Technologies Act, mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security to develop a plan to identify, integrate, and deploy new technologies to enhance border security. The plan includes assessments of technology utilization (especially involving AI, machine learning, and various sensor technologies), coordination with other agencies, privacy impacts, and the scaling of programs. It also authorizes CBP Innovation Teams to research and adapt commercial technologies. The Commissioner of CBP is required to report on the activities of these teams, including their operating procedures, piloted technologies, and transition to existing programs.
